roleset.name: (cause to) become open; change of state, free for passage/entry
roleset.note: OPEN-V NOTES: Watch out for misparsed adjectives as in "The market is open toall comers." This is sometimes tagged (incorrectly) as a verb. (will probably appear in a PRD node in this cases-- .ER) (from open.01-v)
OPENING-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. Vn classes crane-40.3.2, other_cos-45.4, and spacial_configuration-47.6. Framed by Katie. (from opening.01-n)
OPENING-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from opening.01-j)

example.name: agentive
example.text: Texas Instruments Inc. opened a plant in South Korea to manufacture control devices.

example.name: ergative
example.text: The branch of the the Bank for Foreign Economic Affairs opened in July.
example.arg: The branch of the the Bank for Foreign Economic Affairs

example.name: instrumental
example.text: Douglas Wilder opened his gubernatorial battle with Marshall Coleman with an abortion commerical.
example.arg: his gubernatorial battle with Marshall Coleman

example.name: topicalized instrument
example.text: This can opener opens bottles, too!

example.name: benefactive
example.text: South Korea has opened its market to foreign cigarettes.

example.name: Arg 1
example.text: Will the opening of normal commercial activities be considered ?

example.name: With benefactive
example.text: The opening of the Kuantu Bridge to traffic

example.name: Arg 0
example.text: His opening of the Gallary was broadcast locally.

example.name: Arg 0, 1, and 3
example.text: China's opening of trade to the outside

roleset.name: begin
roleset.note: OPEN-V NOTES: As with 'close', mostly of stocks. (from open.02-v)

example.name: ergative
example.text: Thursday the US currency opened for trading at 143.93 yen.

example.name: begin firing
example.text: Can a policeman open fire on someone trying *PRO* to kill him ?
example.arg: on someone trying *PRO* to kill him?

example.name: Beginning...I don't know what!
example.text: `` I 'll open with a virgin , '' says *T*-1 one .

roleset.name: freely giving of info, feelings, free to be seen
roleset.note: OPEN-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1 (from open.04-j)

example.name: all args
example.text: He was open with her about his own life and his own struggles with sin.
example.arg: about his own life and his own struggles with sin

roleset.name: open-minded, freely accepting of input
roleset.note: OPEN-J NOTES: Added by Julia. (from open.05-j)

roles.note: I expect the source of input to be combined with arg2 when it appears. If it appears separate from arg2, send it in, and we'll add an arg. (from open.05-j)

example.name: both args
example.text: If you answered yes to two or fewer questions, you are not very open to change.
example.arg: If you answered yes to two or fewer questions

roleset.name: spacious, unenclosed
roleset.note: OPEN-J NOTES: Added by Julia. (from open.06-j)

example.name: arg1
example.text: It was a little dated in some rooms but the floor plan was open and ideal for a large family, which we had.

example.name: both args
example.text: The tumor itself appeared to have penetrated through the omentum , covering the colon and was open to the peritoneal surface .

roleset.name: available
roleset.note: OPEN-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, WordNet. (from open.02-j)

example.name: args 1, 3
example.text: The position is still open for anyone interested in submitting a resume.
example.arg: for anyone interested in submitting a resume

example.name: concatenation of arg1
example.text: Hoyle said the position is still open for director and several people have already applied.

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: but this position is still open for nominations and a vote.

example.name: args 1, 3
example.text: Scottish citizenship would probably be open to people living in Scotland on the day it becomes independent , and anyone who has at least one grandparent who was born there , or something like that .
example.arg: to people living in Scotland on the day it becomes independent , and anyone who has at least one grandparent who was born there , or something like that

roleset.name: vulnerable/subject to, exposed
roleset.note: OPEN-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, WordNet. (from open.03-j)

example.name: both args
example.text: His unguarded queen was open to attack.

example.name: both args
example.text: Not all of history is open to interpretation.

example.name: both args
example.text: The work is not a question but is open to question, and this corresponds to the fact that interpretations are always contested.

roleset.name: free for passage, entry
roleset.note: OPEN-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on open-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls crane-40.3.2 , (from open.01-j)

role.descr: thing/place open for passage/entry (door, business, etc)

example.name: args 1, 3
example.text: Even though they only had a little strength, the door was open to them.
example.arg: Even though they only had a little strength

example.name: with PRP
example.text: Avon says it is open for business

example.name: args 1, 3 again
example.text: the road is open to traffic

roleset.name: cause to be not closed, complete opening
roleset.note: OPENING_UP-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns, opening.01. See VNcls classes crane-40.3.2, other_cos-45.4, and spacial_configuration-47.6. (from opening.02-n)

example.name: then again, maybe they are present after all
example.src: then again, maybe they are present after all
example.type: then again, maybe they are present after all
example.text: The incentive pay thing has opened up a can of worms.

example.name: args 0, 1, and 3
example.text: Similarly, his policies, his opening up of the White House to numerous Jewish events, and his remarkable ability to empathize with Jewish audiences led Jewish leaders to claim Clinton as one of their own.
